product.title: Writing for Developers: Blogs that get read

scrapbookItems.text: Proud of: What accomplishments are you eager to show off to your engineering peers? What’s really going to impress your users or fellow contributors?

scrapbookItems.text: Pained by: What challenges have been causing constant headaches and blocking you from forward progress? What broader industry pain points are you committed to alleviating?

scrapbookItems.text: Passionate about: What else gets your blood racing? Focus on topics that you’ve earned the right to discuss (thanks to your experiences or special perspective).
scrapbookItems.title: 2 What to write

scrapbookItems.html: Passionate about: What else gets your blood racing? Focus on topics that you’ve earned the right to discuss (thanks to your experiences or special perspective).

scrapbookItems.text: It’s important to keep tabs on what’s new and what people are already talking about in your specific area of interest. This is how you can spot emerging trends and be among the first to start thinking and writing about them. And by keeping your finger on the pulse of a discussion, you can make sure that your take on it actually advances the conversation in some interesting way. Addressing the existing dialogue head-on will win you more friends and upvotes than unintentionally repeating it out of ignorance.
scrapbookItems.title: 2.3 Increasing your trigger exposure

highlights.text: It’s important to keep tabs on what’s new and what people are already talking about in your specific area of interest. This is how you can spot emerging trends and be among the first to start thinking and writing about them. And by keeping your finger on the pulse of a discussion, you can make sure that your take on it actually advances the conversation in some interesting way. Addressing the existing dialogue head-on will win you more friends and upvotes than unintentionally repeating it out of ignorance.

scrapbookItems.html: It’s important to keep tabs on what’s new and what people are already talking about in your specific area of interest. This is how you can spot emerging trends and be among the first to start thinking and writing about them. And by keeping your finger on the pulse of a discussion, you can make sure that your take on it actually advances the conversation in some interesting way. Addressing the existing dialogue head-on will win you more friends and upvotes than unintentionally repeating it out of ignorance.
